thread.title: 3 Stocks Boosting The Leisure Industry Higher

title: 3 Stocks Boosting The Leisure Industry Higher
text: 3 Stocks Boosting The Leisure Industry Higher By TheStreet Wire | 10/19/15 - 01:02 PM EDT Reprint Two out of the three major indices are trading lower today with the Dow Jones Industrial Average ( ^DJI ) trading down 10 points (-0.1%) at 17,206 as of Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, 12:55 PM ET. The NYSE advances/declines ratio sits at 1,332 issues advancing vs. 1,655 declining with 165 unchanged. The Leisure industry currently sits down 0.3% versus the S&P 500, which is down 0.1%. TheStreet would like to highlight 3 stocks pushing the industry higher today: 3. Expedia ( EXPE ) is one of the companies pushing the Leisure industry higher today. As of noon trading, Expedia is up $2.63 (2.1%) to $130.01 on average volume. Thus far, 984,419 shares of Expedia exchanged hands as compared to its average daily volume of 1.8 million shares. The stock has ranged in price between $126.50-$130.49 after having opened the day at $127.43 as compared to the previous trading day's close of $127.38. EXCLUSIVE OFFER: See inside Jim Cramer's multi-million dollar charitable trust portfolio to see the stocks he thinks could be potential winners. Click here to see his holdings for 14-days FREE. Expedia, Inc., together with its subsidiaries, operates as an online travel company in the United States and internationally. The company operates in two segments, Leisure and Egencia. Expedia has a market cap of $14.6 billion and is part of the services sector. Shares are up 49.2% year-to-date as of the close of trading on Friday. Currently there are 10 analysts who rate Expedia a buy, no analysts rate it a sell, and 7 rate it a hold. TheStreet Ratings rates Expedia as a buy . The company's strengths can be seen in multiple areas, such as its solid stock price performance, impressive record of earnings per share growth, compelling growth in net income, revenue growth and notable return on equity. We feel its strengths outweigh the fact that the company has had generally high debt management risk by most measures that we evaluated. Get the full Expedia Ratings Report now.
